subject: Critical Thinking
title: Conspiracy Theory Mechanics: How They Self-Reinforce
description: A quick win: understand Conspiracy Theory Mechanics: How They Self-Reinforce.

hook.text: Evidence against the conspiracy? 'That's what they want you to think.' Evidence for it?

buildup.text: Conspiracy theories are self-sealing: any evidence can be reinterpreted to support the theory.

discovery.text: They satisfy deep needs: pattern-seeking, agency detection, and a sense of special knowledge.

climax.text: Debunking rarely works. The better approach: understand the underlying need & address it without dismissing the person.

punchline.text: Behind every conspiracy theory is a human need for order in a chaotic world.

quiz.question: What psychological needs do conspiracy theories satisfy?
options: Pattern-seeking, agency detection, and a sense of special knowledge
The need for social media engagement
